title.narrative: EISP, phase 2 Environmental Infrastructure Support Program

description.narrative:
The overall objective of the Environmental Infrastructure Support Program (EISP) is to build capacity with the Department for Project Management (DPM) at the Serbian Ministry responsible for Environmental Protection to manage programming and implementation of EU funds. The intended achievement at the end of the contribution is that Serbia has an environmental policy and financing framework supporting EU approximation, and capacities to manage the project pipeline to use EU funds. A pipeline of feasable and bankable environmental infrastructure projects should have been developed. The project is implemented by the procured consultant Brooks Hannas & Partners, in cooperation with the Serbian Ministry for Environmental Protection.
The project started in 2016, and had a decision for cost extension in 2020.

Projektet för stöd till miljöinfrastruktur (Enviornmental Infrastructure Support Program, EISP2) genomförs av det upphandlade konsultföretaget Brooks Hannas & Partners. Den ursprungliga budgeten var på 26 MSEK och projektet startade i januari 2017. En ökning och tidsförlängning beslutades 2020. Målsättningen med projektet är at bistå miljöministeriet med att ta förbereda och genomföra prioriterade miljöinvesteringsprojekt vilket underlättar för Serbien att göra de nödvändiga investeringarna i miljöinfrastruktur med den kvalitet som EU och Serbiens EU förhandlingar kräver.

The project Environmental Infrastructure Support Program, EISP2, is implemented by the procured consulting company Brooks Hannas & Partners. The original budget was SEK 26 million and the project started in January 2017. A budget increase and extension was decided in 2020. The aim of the project is to assist the Ministry of Environmental Protection in preparing and implementing priority environmental investment projects, which facilitates for Serbia to make the necessary investments in environmental infrastructure as required by the EU and in Serbia's EU negotiations.

tag.narrative: 12.5 - By 2030, substantially reduce waste generation through prevention, reduction, recycling and reuse.
12.5 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska mängden avfall genom åtgärder för att förebygga, minska, återanvända och återvinna avfall.

6.3 - By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally.

6.3 - Till 2030 förbättra vattenkvaliteten genom att minska föroreningar, stoppa dumpning och minimera utsläpp av farliga kemikalier och material, halvera andelen obehandlat avloppsvatten och väsentligt öka återvinningen och en säker återanvändning globalt.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the year 2020 and the first half of 2021 the Serbian Government adopted the Serbian negotiating position for the EU environmental and climate policy, as well as several legal frameworks on climate change, renewable energy and energy efficiency. The decisions are important first steps in preparing for EU approximation and decarbonisation of the economy. Overall the interest and priorities to environmental issues are increasing in Serbia, and large-scale investments in waste and waste water is now under development on central and local level. The EISP2 project's support to the Ministry of Environmental Protection has contributed to raising the capacity and the strategic planning of environmental infrastructure investments, for example on how to prioritise and assess projects in waste water and waste sector safeguarding EU environmental standards. The EISP 2 project has also contributed in preparing the final stages of a large scale waste separation reform in the municipalities in Serbia, and facilitated the preparations of large-scale bio-waste management on local level.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
